Partly cloudy skies PERIOD Low 44F PERIOD Winds light and variable PERIOD

Updated November     pm



Last week wellness education and the center for counseling and student development cosponsored this years sexual assault awareness week PERIOD

Events such as a selfdefense class and a candlelight vigil for survivors of sexual assaults were designed to teach students about the problem and show them how to fight back PERIOD A

 march held over to this week will take place Tuesday night PERIOD The event is leaving from College Hill where students and faculty walk carrying signs and banners to Fifth Street PERIOD The students will also do certain chants while on the march to help inform other students about their cause PERIOD Students will then go to Joyner library where they will listen to a speaker PERIOD

Tywanna Jeffries assistant director for wellness education said hundreds of students come to the march every year PERIOD Her hope is to make all students conscious of the problem PERIOD  said Jeffries PERIOD

Jeffries said students first resource is the ECU Police Department PERIOD If a student is assaulted they should always contact the police PERIOD

A fact sheet from the North Carolina Coalition Against Sexual Assault NCCASA said only  percent of victims reported their case to NC law enforcement in  PERIOD

Jeffries said the center for counseling and student development is also available to counsel to students PERIOD

 Jeffries said PERIOD

Jeffries said the victim should also go to the emergency room PERIOD

According to a U.S PERIOD Department of Justice statistics Web site  percent of attempted rapes and  percent of sexual assaults on females result in an injured victim PERIOD

Jeffries also said sexual assault awareness week is meant to teach students preventative techniques PERIOD Some tips include always being aware of the surroundings traveling in groups and keeping an eye on drinks PERIOD

According to a wellness education fact sheet Rohypnol the date rape drug may become invisible once dissolved in a drink PERIOD

Jeffries said you should never take an open drink from anyone even if you know them PERIOD

NCCASA said  percent of NC victims knew their assailant PERIOD

Though sexual assault is uncommon towards collegeaged men awareness is still important for the male population PERIOD

According to the Sexual Assault Care Centers Web site one out of six boys is assaulted before the age of eighteen PERIOD That is not much less than the females rate of one in four PERIOD One in five women has been sexually assaulted sometime in her life PERIOD

Jeffries said sexual assault awareness week has been an annual event at ECU since she can remember PERIOD She began participating in the march when she was a student and now works with planning the events as a professional PERIOD

This writer can be contacted at theeastcarolinian.com PERIOD
